wiki.summary: "Bad", like many of U2's songs, was born of an improvised guitar riff during a loose jam session at Slane Castle, Ireland. A testament to the influence of producers Brian Eno and Daniel Lanois, The Edge's characteristic minimalist guitar sound is accompanied by atmospheric, ambient echo effects. Bono's vague lyrics have led to many fan interpretations of the song's meaning, but Bono frequently told the story behind the song in concert: the song is about heroin—specifically, about a friend of Bono's "who was given on his 21st birthday enough heroin into his bloodstream to kill him.

track.name: Bad
comments: Stunning vocal performance by Bono on this one!  One of my fav's for sure!
exceptional, but what else would one expect from U2
One of my many favorites from the old stuff
My favorite U2 song...after "With Or Without You".
My favorite U2 song.  The live version from Wide Awake in America is AWESOME!!!
they played this at the R.D.S. showgrounds in Dublin for the very 1st time and i was very lucky to be there, will stay with me until my dying days, exceptional
I just simply love this tune!   Hit's home and will always stay with me.
One of their best. Definitely in my U2 top ten
The original version off The Unforgettable Fire and so different to the live version off Wide Awake In America,I love them both.
...short version, but great, great tune.......remember this as a highlight of many a concert, most notably Live Aid........
I have no idea why this song is called "Bad." The word "bad" never appears in the song, and it's not bad at all- it's quite good! In fact, I'd go so far as to say it's awesome!
Album version ends too soon, I like the live versions where they add parts from other songs.
Memories from high school flooding back....love this song.
oh man, this one is really special

Saw them a few weeks ago here in Pittsburgh and the guys did a quick huddle after their would be last two songs (With or Without You and Moment of Surrender) and they came back and played this to close the night.  Best ending to any concert I think I might have ever seen.
